alert.note: Alert for Maries; Miller; Morgan (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 03 at 12:50AM CDT until August 03 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR MARIES, CENTRAL MILLER AND SOUTHERN MORGAN COUNTIES... At 1250 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. This includes the following low water crossings... Rocky Ford Creek at Ritchey Road, Blue Springs Creek at Highway Z, Little Tavern Creek at County Road 220, Montague Creek at County Road 510, Maries River at County Road 211, Weimer Creek at White School Road and Saline Creek at Square Line Road. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
